idea-plugin.name: MetaMask Clone (Showcase)
idea-plugin.description:
Metamask Clone – Wallet Architecture Showcase

Overview

Metamask Clone – Wallet Architecture Showcase is an educational IntelliJ IDEA plugin designed to demonstrate how a wallet-like system can be modeled inside an IDE environment.

This plugin is a technical showcase, focusing on architecture, data flow, and system design, rather than a consumer-ready product.

Important:
This is NOT a production wallet.
No real funds are involved.

Purpose

This plugin exists for learning and demonstration purposes only, aimed at developers and system architects who want to understand:

  • How a wallet-style system can be structured
  • How transaction flows are modeled internally
  • How backend concepts map to UI components
  • How to build non-trivial IntelliJ plugins

It is not intended for real asset management or end-user usage.

Supported Networks

  • EVM Networks: Ethereum, BNB Smart Chain, Polygon (ERC20 tokens)
  • TRON Network: TRON Mainnet, Shasta Testnet (TRC20 tokens)

Key Characteristics

  • Educational / showcase-oriented plugin
  • Multi-chain wallet architecture demonstration
  • No custody of private keys
  • No security guarantees
  • No financial functionality

All behaviors are either simulated or simplified for clarity.

Intended Audience

  • Backend engineers
  • Plugin developers
  • System architects
  • Developers learning wallet system architecture
  • Developers interested in IntelliJ Plugin development

Important Disclaimer

This plugin is not affiliated with, endorsed by, or connected to MetaMask or any related organization.

The term “Metamask Clone” is used solely as a descriptive reference to indicate architectural inspiration and learning context.

Licensing & Responsibility

By installing this plugin, you acknowledge that:

  • This plugin is provided as-is
  • It should not be used for managing real assets
  • The author assumes no responsibility for misuse

Why This Plugin Exists

This plugin is part of a broader educational effort to explain wallet system design from a backend and architectural perspective, not to replicate or replace any existing product.

Video Tutorial Series

idea-plugin.change-notes:
Version 1.3

  • TRC20 Token Support: Import, view balance, and transfer TRC20 tokens
  • Auto-fetch TRC20 token metadata (symbol, name, decimals) from contract
  • Fee limit configuration for TRC20 transfers (energy cost control)
  • Full Base58Check validation for TRON addresses with checksum verification

Version 1.2

  • TRX Balance Display: View TRX balance for TRON wallets via gRPC
  • TRX Transfer: Send TRX to other TRON addresses
  • TRON transactions show "Free (uses bandwidth)" instead of gas fees
  • Proper TRON address validation (T-prefix, 34 characters)
  • TronScan explorer integration for transaction viewing

Version 1.1

  • TRON Blockchain Support (Early): Added TRON Mainnet and Shasta Testnet
  • Create, import, export, and delete TRON wallets
  • TRON wallets are managed separately from EVM wallets
  • Receive functionality with QR code for TRON addresses
  • Updated network RPC endpoints to use public nodes
  • Replaced deprecated Polygon Mumbai with Polygon Amoy testnet
  • Bug fixes and UI improvements

Version 1.0

  • Initial release of the educational showcase plugin
  • Introduced basic wallet-style UI for architectural demonstration
  • Added simulated account and transaction flow examples
  • Implemented foundational IntelliJ Tool Window integration
  • Focused on plugin structure, data flow, and system design concepts

This plugin is intended solely for educational and demonstration purposes.
